--- Page 1 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2023/0558 b) Date of Occurrence: 07/12/2024
c) Installation Details: Minotaur Heavy - AC-1620-678 at
Regional Depot-C
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Armament b) Date Component 10/12/2024
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Ammunition Feed d) Main Assembly: Station-2 Starboard
e) Nomenclature: Ammunition Feed Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: MOD-D
g) Part No.: AR-1374-L9 h) Sl No.: SN-8660-941
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 16/06/2021 l) Date of Removal: 08/12/2024
Pg No: 122 Ln No: 24 Pg No: 99 Ln No: 10
m) Manufacturing Agency: Sigma Aerospace Industries n) Date, Month & Year April 2015
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: Yes p) Whether under AMC No
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 3644 Hrs / 607 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Major
b) Defect Observed: Fire control computer error. Malfunction reported by flight crew.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Component fatigue due to operational stress cycles exceeding design limits
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Ammunition Feed component. Functional
testing confirmed the reported anomaly.
c) Remedial Measures Clean and re-lubricate affected assemblies per technical manual
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Update technical documentation with lessons learned
d) Attributable Code: N - Not established
Remarks: Detailed examination conducted. Corrective measures implemented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Design review completed. No design modification required. Component replacement as per maintenance manual is adequate.
Date: 01/01/2025 Authorized Signatory of Design: Dr. P.L. Mehta

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Component inspection records verified. All quality parameters were within acceptable limits during manufacturing.
Date: 03/01/2025 Signature: Air Cmde R.K. Joshi
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
Operational history analyzed. No abnormal usage patterns identified. Agree with proposed corrective actions.
Date: 02/01/2025 Signature: Sqn Ldr A.R. Desai
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
From quality standpoint, root cause analysis is thorough. Corrective measures are appropriate. Concur.
Date: 04/01/2025 Signature: Wg Cdr D.S. Nair
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
From regulatory standpoint, investigation meets required standards. Approve proposed corrective actions.
Date: 06/01/2025 Signature: Dr. S.M. Kulkarni
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
